intro: Oligactis ochracea, commonly known as the yellow star moss, is a species of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, spirally arranged leaves that are typically yellow-green in color. Oligactis ochracea thrives in rocky or soil substrates, often in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as archegonia, are located on the underside of the leaves.
